alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Brown; Johnson; Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 8:53AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Shelby, southeastern Johnson, northeastern Brown and Bartholomew Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 852 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Nashville, or 12 miles northwest of Columbus, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Columbus around 900 AM EDT. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 63 and 81. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
